Agency: Labor Department Wage and Hour Division
NAICS Translation: 811118: Other Automotive Mechanical and Electrical Repair and Maintenance
Info Source: March 7, 2017 download of a dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division at https://enforcedata.dol.gov/views/data_summary.php
Notes: Date and year are the Findings End Date in the dataset posted by the Wage and Hour Division, which does not provide case opening or closing dates. The company name is the Legal Name provided by the dataset unless that field is blank, in which case the Trade Name is used. The dataset provides only one address and does not indicate whether it is the company headquarters address or the establishment address. The penalty amount is the total of civil monetary penalties and mandated back wages. The original dataset provides a breakdown.

Private Litigation Case Title: Lugo v. Autozoners, LLC et al

Court: Superior Court of State of California, County of Orange
Info Source: http://gbdhlegal.com/cases/myart-v-autozone/

Description: The punitive damage award was reduced from $2.5 million to $1 million by the Missouri Court of Appeals in ruling WD77861.
Private Litigation Case Title: Delise?Diaz v. Autozone?Inc. and AutoZoners LLC
Info Source: https://www.courts.mo.gov/file.jsp?id=93995

Description: The award, which included $221,000 to the plaintiff plus $79,374 in legal fees and $3.068 in costs, was upheld by the 8th Circuit in ruling no. 06-3509.
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/30450

Private Litigation Case Title: Antonio Aceves et al v. Autozone Inc.
Info Source: https://www.law360.com/articles/799598/autozone-s-5-7m-deal-in-credit-check-suit-gets-tentative-ok
https://www.oag.ca.gov/news/press-releases/attorney-general-becerra-announces-11-million-settlement-against-autozone
https://www.nj.gov/oag/newsreleases16/pr20160329a.html
https://web.archive.org/web/20101115234555/http://www.ag.ny.gov/media_center/2003/feb/feb21a_03.html

Description: AutoZone agreed to pay $11 million in settlement of allegations it unlawfully disposed of hazardous waste in landfills not authorized for such material, by allowing customers to deposit waste into regular trash containers. Joining in the settlement were the District Attorneys of  Alameda, Monterey, Riverside,San Bernardino, San Diego, San Francisco, San Joaquin, Solano, Ventura and Yolo Counties, and the Los Angeles City Attorney.
Info Source: https://www.alcoda.org/newsroom/2019/jun/hazardous_waste_settlement#more

Description: AutoZone agreed to pay $1.5 million to the District Attorneys of San Bernardino, San Diego, San Joaquin and Monterey counties as well as the state attorney general to resolve allegations relating to the mishandling of hazardous wastes.
Info Source: Auto Zone to settle cases for $1.5 million, San Diego Union-Tribune, June 2, 2007 (via Nexis).
